required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparing Semaglutide Administered Subcutaneously Once Daily to Semaglutide Administered Subcutaneously Once Weekly
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Double-blind, Placebo Controlled, Double Dummy, Single-centre Trial in Healthy Subjects Comparing the Steady-state Exposure of Semaglutide Administered Subcutaneously Once Daily to Semaglutide Administered Subcutaneously Once Weekly

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is conducted in Europe. The aim of this trial is to compare the steady-state exposure of semaglutide administered subcutaneously once daily to semaglutide administered subcutaneously once weekly in healthy subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the semaglutide concentration-time curves
primary_outcome.time_frame: At steady-state from 0 to168 hours after dosing on day 78

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At steady-state derived from the concentration-time curves, within 168 hours from day 78

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of treatment emergent adverse events (TEAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (day 1, post-dose) to last follow-up visit (day 120)

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the the single dose concentration-time curve
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 0 to 300 min after administration of paracetamol (1.5 g) at day 51

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the the single dose concentration-time curve
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 0 to 300 min after administration of paracetamol (1.5 g) at day 79

arm_group.arm_group_label: placebo semaglutide OW + placebo semaglutide OD

intervention.description: Administered subcutaneously (s.c., under the skin)once daily or once weekly.
Administered subcutaneously (s.c., under the skin)once daily or once weekly.
intervention.arm_group_label: placebo semaglutide OW + placebo semaglutide OD

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female, aged 18-55 years (both inclusive) at the time of signing informed consent
- Considered to be generally healthy based on the medical history, physical examination, and the results of vital signs, ECG and clinical laboratory tests performed during the screeningvisit, as judged by the investigator
- Body mass index (BMI) between 20.0 and 29.9 kg/m^2 (both inclusive)
- HbA1c (glycosylated haemoglobin) below 6.5%
Exclusion Criteria:
- Female who is pregnant, breast-feeding or intends to become pregnant or is of childbearing potential and not using adequate contraceptive method throughout the trial including the 5 weeks follow-up period (adequate contraceptive measures as required by local regulation or practice)
- Any disorder which in the investigator's opinion might jeopardise subject's safety, evaluation of results, or compliance with the protocol
- History of pancreatitis (acute or chronic)
- Screening calcitonin equal or above 50 ng/L
- Family or personal history of Multiple Endocrine Neoplasia Type 2 (MEN2) or Medullary Thyroid Carcinoma (MTC)
